text: Netmarble's latest collaboration with Big Hit Entertainment, BTS Universe Story. [NETMARBLE] Boy band BTS Netmarble’s latest mobile game BTS Universe Story. [NETMARBLE] Local game company Smilegate's IP of first-person shooter (FPS) game CrossFire made into a drama with the same title in China. [SMILEGATE] The Witcher game, left, and a Netflix remake, right. [SCREEN CAPTURE, NETFLIX] BTS joined forces with first-person shooter game Fortnite, developed by U.S. publisher Epic Games, to reveal a new version of its music video for the latest single ’Dynamite“ on Sept. 26. [BIG HIT ENTERTAINMENT] Girl group Blackpink also collaborated with the mobile version of local shooter game PlayerUnknown’s Battlegrounds, by playing the band’s track ’How You Like That“ (2020) as the background music for players waiting at the ’lobby“ at the beginning of the game. title: Universes collide when IP is expanded across sectors
